person.name: Sai Saran Rangisetti
person.tagline: Frontend Engineer crafting scalable React apps with data-driven UX

summary: Frontend Software Engineer with React, Python, and AWS experience. Built interactive dashboards for real‑time analytics and improved UI consistency with a shared design system. Pursuing an MS in AI & Business Analytics to blend engineering with product impact.

education.degree: MS, Artificial Intelligence and Business Analytics

bullets: Designed and built interactive React dashboards backed by SQL for real‑time analytics and faster decisions.
Automated reporting workflows in Python, reducing manual effort and improving operational efficiency.
Drove UI consistency with atomic design and a shared component library.
Led daily scrums and stakeholder updates aligning delivery with business goals.
Improved quality via code reviews and unit tests across the team.
Led front‑end architecture for Guidewire PolicyCenter, improving a11y, responsiveness, and personalization.
Built automation for vehicle history retrievals via REST + React, reducing processing time.
Resolved high‑priority bugs across Guidewire modules in collaboration with backend and QA.
Delivered internal tech talks and documentation to speed onboarding and consistency.
Mentored junior developers on code quality and system architecture.
Developed a reusable dashboard used across multiple Guidewire implementations, cutting duplicate efforts.
Ran usability testing with clients and engineers; shipped UX improvements from qualitative feedback.
Earned Guidewire Associate Certification with ClaimCenter/BillingCenter exposure.
Contributed across SDLC: planning, development, and production releases with cross‑border teams.

projects.name: AI Recycling Detection
projects.hook: Classified recyclable materials with ML and surfaced results on a visual dashboard.
outcomes: Implemented Python classification pipeline on structured/unstructured inputs.
Integrated model outputs with a React dashboard for monitoring.
Collaborated on data prep and QR‑based tracking prototype.

projects.name: Embedded Night System for Pedestrian Detection
projects.hook: Real‑time pedestrian detection prototype using embedded sensors and feature extraction.
outcomes: Collected and analyzed live sensor data to detect motion patterns.
Implemented logic‑based algorithms for movement detection.
Built foundation for embedded ML concepts.
projects.logoAlt: Pedestrian crossing icon on dark background

projects.name: Infrastructure Automation Using Terraform
projects.hook: Provisioned AWS resources with Terraform to streamline DevOps workflows.
outcomes: Automated EC2, S3, and IAM policies for reusable environments.
Improved delivery speed with IaC best practices.
